intro: Galium nutans, commonly known as the leaning woodcrushers, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit, with slender stems that often recline toward the ground. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Galium nutans is native to various regions of the Northern Hemisphere and thrives in moist, shady environments.
